marketNews.title: Airlangga Hartarto denies rumors of Sri Mulyani's resignation
marketNews.content: Minister of Coordinating Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto on Sunday (31/8) denied rumors of Finance Minister Sri Mulyani's resignation from the cabinet. Airlangga explained that Sri Mulyani attended the cabinet meeting at the Presidential Palace in Jakarta on Sunday (31/8). Antara reported that the clarification came after Sri Mulyani was again rumored to resign from her post.

marketNews.title: Indonesia consumer price index (CPI) August 2025
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Consumer Price Index (CPI) recorded a year-on-year increase of 2.31% in August 2025 (versus 2.37% YoY in July 2025). On a monthly basis, the CPI showed a deflation of 0.08% MoM (versus a 0.3% increase in July 2025). The expenditure groups driving inflation were food, beverages and tobacco (1.14 percentage points) and gold jewellery (0.45 percentage points). Core inflation in August 2025 was 0.06% MoM and 2.17% YoY.

marketNews.title: Indonesia manufacturing PMI rises to 51.5 in August 2025
marketNews.content: The Indonesian manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.5 in August 2025 (versus 49.2 in July 2025), marking the highest level since March 2025 and the first expansion in five months. Factory activity recovered with higher output and new orders after four consecutive months of contraction, while foreign demand grew at the fastest pace since September 2023. Employment rose slightly, ending a three-month streak of job contraction. Business sentiment improved with expectations of stronger demand, new product launches and higher consumer purchasing power.

marketNews.title: Indonesia trade surplus expands to USD 4.18 billion in July 2025
marketNews.content: Indonesia's trade surplus reached USD 4.18 billion in July 2025 (versus USD 5.01 billion in July 2024 and USD 4.11 billion in June 2025), driven by exports that grew 9.86% YoY and imports that fell 5.86% YoY. Over the first seven months of 2025, the trade surplus amounted to USD 23.65 billion (versus USD 15.92 billion in the same period of 2024), with exports and imports up 8.03% YoY and 3.41% YoY respectively.

marketNews.title: U.S. core PCE index rises 0.3% MoM in July 2025
marketNews.content: The United States core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index rose 0.3% month-on-month in July 2025 (versus 0.3% MoM in June 2025), matching consensus. Year-over-year, the core PCE index increased 2.9%, also in line with consensus and marking the highest level in five months. The core PCE index is the Federal Reserve’s preferred gauge of inflation relative to its 2% target.

marketNews.title: IPCC cargo handling up 12.3% YoY in first seven months of 2025
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s vehicle-terminal operator PT Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal Tbk (IPCC) handled 641,746 cargo units during the first seven months of 2025, a 12.3% year-on-year increase. Truck and bus cargo handling rose 24.4% YoY to 111,946 units, and heavy-equipment cargo handling rose 34.3% YoY to 18,588 units. Vessel calls at IPCC-managed berths increased to 1,834, up 13.1% YoY.

marketNews.title: WIRG sells 31 million shares at IDR 209 per share
marketNews.content: PT WIR Global Kreatif sold 31 million shares of PT WIR Global Kreatif (WIRG) at an average price of IDR 209 per share on 27 August 2025, amounting to roughly IDR 6.5 billion. After the transaction, the direct ownership of PT WIR Global Kreatif in WIRG fell from 10.002% to 9.742%.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo announces removal of DPR allowances and travel moratorium
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto, together with the chairmen of political parties, said on Sunday (31/8) that the government will eliminate the allowance for members of the House of Representatives and will impose a moratorium on overseas official trips. The move responds to public demand amid demonstrations across regions. Prabowo also said the DPR will soon open a direct dialogue channel with the public.

marketNews.title: Foreign tourist arrivals rise 13% YoY in July 2025
marketNews.content: Foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia reached approximately 1.5 million people in July 2025, a 13% year-on-year increase and 4.6% month-on-month. The total number of foreign visitors in the first seven months of 2025 rose 10% YoY to about 8.5 million, representing 53-61% of the government’s 2025 target of 14-16 million visitors.

tickerNews.title: Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) posts 2Q25 net profit of USD 233 million
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI) reported net profit of USD 233 million in 2Q25 (+19% QoQ, –60% YoY). The result lifted 1H25 net profit to USD 429 million, down 50% YoY but above the 57% consensus estimate thanks to a resilient gross margin and efficient opex. Revenue rose 6.1% QoQ, driven by a 7.3% QoQ increase in sales volume to 17.58 million tonnes while the average selling price (ASP) fell 1.3% QoQ to USD 67 per tonne. Net profit margin rose 200 basis points QoQ to 18.8% after a reversal from a USD 5 million loss in 1Q25 to a USD 28 million gain in 2Q25. Gross profit grew 0.2% QoQ, supported by a 22% QoQ decline in royalty fees after the government lowered the IUPK royalty rate. Production volume rose 9% QoQ to 17.5 million tonnes and the stripping ratio improved to 4.3× (vs. 3.2× in 1Q25).

tickerNews.title: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) posts 2Q25 net profit of USD 98 million
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO) posted a net profit of USD 98 million in 2Q25 (+28% QoQ, –76% YoY), bringing 1H25 net profit to USD 175 million, down 78% YoY and below the 39% consensus estimate. The shortfall stemmed from weak 1Q25 performance despite a 25% QoQ revenue increase. Revenue reached USD 476 million (+25% QoQ), with metallurgical coal sales volume up 25% QoQ despite a 7% QoQ drop in ASP. Operating margin rose to 30.3% (vs. 20.8% in 1Q25) as cost of sales grew only 11.4% QoQ while opex fell 4.4% QoQ. Production of metallurgical coal rose 18.2% QoQ to 1.88 million tonnes; stripping ratio fell to 3.3× (vs. 3.55× in 1Q25).

tickerNews.title: Aneka Tambang (ANTM) posts 2Q25 net profit of IDR 2.6 trillion
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang ($ANTM) recorded net profit of IDR 2.6 trillion in 2Q25 (+96% QoQ, +20% YoY), taking 1H25 net profit to IDR 4.7 trillion (+203% YoY) and beating the 67% consensus estimate. Quarterly profit growth was driven by a 126% QoQ revenue increase and an operating-margin expansion to 10.5% (vs. 7% in 1Q25). Outside operations saw a foreign-exchange loss of IDR 98 billion (previously a gain of IDR 328 billion in 1Q25), pulling net-margin down to 7.8% (vs. 9% in 1Q25).

tickerNews.title: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) 7M25 net profit falls 11% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) posted a bank-only net profit of IDR 1.7 trillion in July 2025 (-11% YoY, +3% MoM). The 7-month-to-date (7M25) net profit was IDR 11.9 trillion, down 5% YoY and equal to 56.4% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 58.3% in 7M24). The decline was driven by a 10% YoY drop in pre-provision operating profit and an 8% YoY fall in net interest income, while operating expenses rose 6% YoY and provisions rose 6% YoY. Credit growth was +6% YoY in July 2025.

tickerNews.title: Axiata Investments sells 136.2 million LINK shares
tickerNews.content: Axiata Investments (Indonesia) Sdn. Bhd., the controlling shareholder of Link Net ($LINK), sold approximately 136.2 million LINK shares on 26 August 2025 at an average price of IDR 3,060 per share, for a total transaction value of about IDR 417 billion. The sale reduced Axiata’s ownership from 75.42% to 70.66%.

tickerNews.title: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) 2Q25 net profit of USD 82 million
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS) posted a net profit of USD 82 million in 2Q25 (+26% YoY, +33% QoQ). The 1H25 net profit was USD 144 million, down 23% YoY and below the 44% consensus estimate. Operating profit was USD 136 million in 2Q25 (-6% YoY, +34% QoQ) despite a 14% YoY rise in cost of sales versus a flat 0% QoQ revenue increase. The 1H25 operating profit was USD 238 million, down 25% YoY, slightly under the 48% consensus estimate.

tickerNews.title: UBS Group AG acquires 91 million Bumi Resources shares
tickerNews.content: UBS Group AG bought approximately 91 million Bumi Resources shares on 25 August 2025 at roughly IDR 112 per share, a total of about IDR 10.2 billion. The purchase increased UBS’s stake from 6.98% to 7.01% and was intended for client-side derivative hedging.

tickerNews.title: ISAT chief executive Vikram Sinha purchases 969,100 shares
tickerNews.content: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison ($ISAT) chief executive Vikram Sinha bought 969,100 shares at an average price of IDR 2,060 per share on 25 August 2025, for a total transaction value of roughly IDR 2 billion. His ownership rose from 0.0243% to 0.0272%.

tickerNews.title: BRMS shareholder Sugiman Halim buys 100 million shares
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS) shareholder Sugiman Halim bought 100 million shares, according to KSEI data on 28 August 2025. The transaction value was not disclosed. Ownership rose from 7.37% to 7.44%.

tickerNews.title: Saratoga Investama sells 211.1 million MDKA shares
tickerNews.content: Saratoga Investama Sedaya sold 211.1 million shares of Merdeka Copper Gold ($MDKA) at an average price of IDR 1,925 per share on 26 August 2025, totalising about IDR 406 billion. Ownership fell from 20.34% to 20.34% → 19.47%.

tickerNews.title: WIRG sells 31 million shares at IDR 209 per share
tickerNews.content: PT WIR Global Kreatif sold 31 million shares of PT WIR Global Kreatif (WIRG) at an average price of IDR 209 per share on 27 August 2025, totalising about IDR 6.5 billion. The sale reduced the company’s direct ownership in WIRG from 10.002% to 9.742%.
